question.body: Rank the order of length scales from smallest to largest:

multiple_choice.choice: carbon atom → insulin (a protein, which is a molecule) → pancreatic beta cells
insulin (a protein, which is a molecule) → carbon atom → pancreatic beta cells
carbon atom → pancreatic beta cells → insulin (a protein, which is a molecule)
pancreatic beta cells → carbon atom → insulin (a protein, which is a molecule)

response.feedback: Correct. Insulin is 44x larger than calcium and pancreatic beta cells are 4000x larger than insulin.
Incorrect. Atoms and ions are smaller than proteins. Insulin is made up of more than a thousand atoms.
Incorrect. Cells are larger than ions, but cells are much larger than proteins.
Cells are the largest of these choices

part.hint: Insulin is a protein made of 51 amino acids, and each amino acid has about 20 atoms.
In most cells, are more than a billion proteins.
